title: Fashion Through the Decades
description: From poodle skirts to bell-bottoms to shoulder pads â€” how well do you know the fashion trends of each era?

questions.question: Poodle skirts became a fashion craze among teenage girls in the 1950s. What type of fabric were they typically made from?
questions.explanation: Poodle skirts were made from felt because it was inexpensive and didn't need hemming. Juli Lynne Charlot created the first one in 1947 as a last-minute Christmas party outfit.

questions.question: Saddle shoes, the two-toned oxford shoes popular with 1950s teenagers, were most commonly what two colors?
questions.explanation: The classic saddle shoe combination was white with a black 'saddle' across the middle. They became a staple of 1950s teen fashion, often paired with bobby socks.

questions.question: The towering beehive hairdo, popularized in the early 1960s, was created by a stylist from which city?
questions.explanation: Margaret Vinci Heldt, a Chicago hairstylist, created the beehive in 1960 for Modern Beauty Salon magazine. She was inspired by a fez hat she owned. The style became an icon of the era.

questions.question: Go-go boots, the knee-high fashion boots of the 1960s, were popularized by which fashion designer?
questions.explanation: French designer Andre Courreges introduced the white, low-heeled go-go boot in 1964 as part of his futuristic fashion collection. Nancy Sinatra's 'These Boots Are Made for Walkin'' cemented them in pop culture.

questions.question: The miniskirt, one of the most revolutionary fashion items of the 1960s, is most associated with which British designer?
questions.explanation: Mary Quant is credited with popularizing the miniskirt from her London boutique, Bazaar, in the mid-1960s. She named it after her favorite car, the Mini Cooper.

questions.question: Bell-bottom pants became mainstream fashion in the 1970s, but they originally came from what source?
questions.explanation: Bell-bottoms originated with US Navy sailors in the early 1800s. The wide legs could be rolled up for swabbing decks and made it easier to remove pants quickly if a sailor fell overboard.

questions.question: The leisure suit, a symbol of 1970s fashion, was typically made from what synthetic fabric?
questions.explanation: Leisure suits were almost always made from polyester, which contributed to both their popularity (easy care, wrinkle-free) and their eventual downfall as the fabric became associated with tackiness.

questions.question: Tie-dye clothing became a symbol of the counterculture movement in the late 1960s. Which music festival in 1969 helped make tie-dye a mainstream fashion statement?
questions.explanation: Woodstock in August 1969 brought tie-dye into the national spotlight. The ancient fabric dyeing technique became a visual shorthand for peace, love, and the hippie movement.

questions.question: Platform shoes reached peak popularity in the 1970s. How tall were the soles on some of the most extreme disco-era platforms?
questions.explanation: Some disco-era platform shoes had soles up to 6 inches high. Both men and women wore them, and they became essential footwear at clubs like Studio 54.

questions.question: Mood rings, the color-changing jewelry fad of the 1970s, contained what type of special material?
questions.explanation: Mood rings contained thermochromic liquid crystals that changed color in response to body temperature. Inventor Josh Reynolds introduced them in 1975, and they became an instant craze.

questions.question: Power suits with exaggerated shoulder pads became a defining fashion trend of the 1980s. Which TV show is often credited with popularizing the look?
questions.explanation: Joan Collins' glamorous power suits on 'Dynasty' (1981-1989) helped define 1980s fashion. Costume designer Nolan Miller created increasingly dramatic shoulder-padded outfits for the show.

questions.question: Leg warmers became a mainstream fashion trend in the early 1980s after appearing in which popular movie?
questions.explanation: Jennifer Beals wore leg warmers in 'Flashdance' (1983), launching them from dance studios into everyday fashion. The film's influence on fashion extended to off-the-shoulder sweatshirts as well.

questions.question: Members Only jackets, the iconic 1980s fashion staple, were originally manufactured by which company?
questions.explanation: Europe Craft Imports launched the Members Only jacket in 1980. With its signature epaulets and snap-tab collar, it became one of the decade's most recognizable fashion items, selling millions.

questions.question: Ray-Ban Wayfarer sunglasses, first introduced in 1956, saw a massive resurgence in the 1980s after appearing in which Tom Cruise film?
questions.explanation: Tom Cruise wore Ray-Ban Wayfarers in 'Risky Business' (1983), boosting sales from 18,000 pairs a year to over 1.5 million. He later boosted Ray-Ban Aviator sales with 'Top Gun.'

questions.question: In the 1950s, pearl necklaces became a symbol of elegance and were closely associated with which First Lady?
questions.explanation: Mamie Eisenhower was rarely seen without her signature pearl necklaces, helping make them a must-have accessory for well-dressed women in the 1950s. Her style influenced fashion across America.
